snippet: The university’s reach into the Middle East showed the perils of mixing liberal ideals with an economy dependent on impoverished migrant workers.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column cites Human Rights Watch report showing severity of mistreatment of workers constructing New York University campus in United Arab Emirates, noting university codified fair treatment for workers, but code was not enforced; remarks episode highlights moral peril of combining liberal ideals with economy reliant on cheap labor from poor migrant workers.
lead_paragraph: The university’s reach into the Middle East showed the perils of mixing liberal ideals with an economy dependent on impoverished migrant workers.

headline.print_headline: Report Details the Worker Complaints That Blurred N.Y.U.’s Emirates Vision
headline.main: Report Details the Worker Complaints That Blurred N.Y.U.’s Emirates Vision

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
